title.narrative: COVID-19 relief: Food and Essentials for the poor

description.narrative: India's nation-wide lockdown for curbing COVID-19 has hurt the daily wage earners and poor underprivileged families severely. They have lost their income. Poverty having prevented them from saving any money, they are now unable to buy food. They are starving. This project will help families in the State of West Bengal. Food and essentials kits - with rice, pulses, potatoes, oil, salt, biscuits, masks and soaps - will provide them with sustenance and safety while ensuring their survival.

mailing-address.narrative: Anant Nevatia, 63 Chowringhee Road, 33 Alexandra Court, Kolkata, West Bengal 700020, India

title.narrative: Action for Education: Back to School

description.narrative: In March, the threat of Covid-19 forced our education centres on the Aegean islands to close. Since then, asylum seekers have faced months of isolation and congestion in overcrowded camps. Now, as lockdown measures are slowly lifted, we're getting ready to get back to school.

mailing-address.narrative: Jacob Warn, Tsouri 6, Chios, 82100, Greece

title.narrative: Save 500 Vulnerable Families in Nigeria COVID-19

description.narrative: This project is designed to provide foodstuffs to 500 vulnerable households in Ohaji/Egbema, Imo State of Nigeria. Ohaji/Egbema is a densely populated Local Government in Imo State with the majority of the people living in extreme poverty and and the impact of hunger has pushed many of the youths in the area indulge themselves in cultism and crime. The project will help to reduce hunger and cultism in the area. Awarra Court Area is an area that has been seriously affected during this COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Foundation for Social-Economic Development of African Communities for Peaceful Co-Existence

mailing-address.narrative: Gift Egbelu, Civic Centre, Ozumba Mbadiwe Avenue, Victoria Island, Lagos 234, Nigeria

title.narrative: Promote 100 Agric-Chain Jobs for Jobless Nigerian

description.narrative: This project initiative will support 100 Agricultural Value Chain Enterprises jobs for Nigerian youth among teaming unemployed graduates and open more doors to food production, alleviating poverty and reducing the post economic negative effects of COVID-19 pandemic .

description.narrative: This project will build stronger response capacities of older persons through RECEWAPEC Eye-care Center in Bambui, Cameroon so that we are all better equipped to face the COVID-19 pandemic.

organisation.narrative: The Regional Center for the welfare of ageing person in Cameroon(RECEWAPEC)

description.narrative: Do you know that 7 in 10 children do not complete primary school in Malawi? To change this, CharChar delivers an accelerated Literacy Programme, helping to reduce high drop-out rates in Primary School and providing a sustainable route out of poverty through education. With your help we will be able to expand our volunteer literacy teacher corps to reach over 6,000 underprivileged primary school-age children in Malawi and reverse the negative impacts of COVID-19. Education cannot wait!

mailing-address.narrative: Melina San Martin, Flat 15, Evesham House Hereford Road, London, W2 4PD, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Protecting 3000 people from Covid-19 in Yemen

description.narrative: The project aims to provide food for 3,000 members of the poor Yemeni families headed by people suffering from chronic diseases or the elderly in Al-Sunainah area in Sanaa, because they are threatened with death as a result of Covid-19, as well as providing hygiene soap and face masks, and educating these families about the risk of the epidemic and how to prevent it.

mailing-address.narrative: Progress Organization, Sana'a, haddah s.t, Al-musbahi cross, Al-nuzaili building., Sana'a, yemen 00967, Yemen

title.narrative: Plying Health Services to 120 Under Tent Children

description.narrative: By providing healthcare awareness and services to the under tent children, we will save them from the die of several sicknesses. Mostly, the Coronavirus that is spreading rapidly in Afghanistan we need to follow and obtain the cautions against the pandemic virus. It is obvious that observing personal cleanliness is very important for affecting the prevention, so, unfortunately, the under tent children don't have access to healthcare awareness and service.

mailing-address.narrative: Habiba Payandanik, Darulaman Street, Kabul, 25000, Afghanistan

description.narrative: SHAKHI 'Friends of Women' is a grassroots feminist organization working with marginalized women. Pregnant women and newborn children get nutrition food, medicines, and essential supplies during the COVID-19 pandemic. Your donation to this fund will support immediate and long-term relief and recovery in vulnerable communities especially pregnant mothers and newborn children during one of the most challenging times we are collectively facing.

mailing-address.narrative: SHAKHI Friends of Women, Pheta Rural Municipality, Ward No 1, Bhaluhi, Bhaluhi, 44400, Nepal

description.narrative: Cosma seeks funding to establish and maintain a community fund in the Masaka sub-region of Uganda to re-capitalize existing farmer cooperatives which have faced an unexpected financial crisis due COVID 19. These member cooperatives will be able to borrow money from the community fund to help individual member farmers overcome socio-economic hardship arising from the COVID 19 lock down.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 25 Kimuli road, Mateete town council Sembabule district, P.O BOX 14 NATEETE, KAMPALA, Sembabule, Central region 256, Uganda

title.narrative: COVID-19 Expansion of existing ventilator capacity

description.narrative: In the framework of the COVID-19 pandemic in Argentina, the forecasts of infected people at the peak of contagion that will require connection to ventilators by far exceeds the current available capacity. This project proposes the development of a low complexity kit that allows quadrupling the capacity of each ventilator in a context of peak demand and saturation of the available ones. This kit may be manufactured locally in each country.

organisation.narrative: Asociacion Civil Ingenieria sin Fronteras Argentina

mailing-address.narrative: Adan Javier Levy, Medrano 1622, 5, Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires, C1425GDB, Argentina

title.narrative: SUPPORT FUND TO REDUCE SPREAD OF COVID-19 NIGERIA

description.narrative: COVID-19 pandemic is threatening everyone's way of life worldwide, but for those living in poverty, the potential impact is massive. Your donation to this fund will help stop COVID-19 spread and help to provide - face mask, hand-sanitizer, soap + handwashing buckets with tap and food parcels to help 1000 vulnerable families in Nigeria to survive, during one of the most challenging time we have collectively faced.

mailing-address.narrative: Julius Maduka, Ibenabor Village, Oraukwu, Idemili North Local Government Area, Onitsha, 420001, Nigeria

title.narrative: Help Women Flee Domestic Violence During COVID-19

description.narrative: This project will assist women and their children left without a means to navigate through the system of domestic abuse outside of a shelter environment. Victims receive free domestic violence counseling, therapy, case management, safety plans, support groups, protective orders, crime victims' compensation applications, and shelter placement if needed. As the foundation that bridges the steps between not needing a shelter and not being able to afford the private counseling needed to help heal.

organisation.narrative: Fresh Spirit Wellness for Women Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: Demethra Orion, 5100 Westheimer Rd, Ste 200, Houston, TX 77056, United States

description.narrative: This scale up project proposal aims at mitigating gender based violence injustice in South Sudan. its noted that GBV escalates during crisis, as the world faces COVID-19 pandemic, intimate partner violence among other vices perpetrated against women and girls are on the rise. Save a Life International intends to construct 3 safe houses with a capacity of 600 women, girls and the disabled. We will as well train men, women and local authorities to be awareness ambassadors against GBV vices.

mailing-address.narrative: James Mwangi, 21st street 23rd avenue Juba, Juba, 211, South Sudan

title.narrative: Rapid support of 90 small young Farmers in Rwanda

description.narrative: This project aim is to support local young farmers affected by COVID-19 and fight stunting of children living in Community in Ruhango District. This project will support 60 youth who are in agribusiness of horticulture and 30 who are in livestock of poultry farming in southern province of Rwanda in Ruhango District shocked by the Pandemic of COVID-19 .RODI will provide Technical assistance ,Coaching, some materials , demonstration plots and distribution of layer Chickens and Cows .

title.narrative: Build 10 wells for schools and villages in uganda

description.narrative: Buhaguzi Action For Rural Development Foundation(BUARDEFO ) is to build 10 wells to support 08 schools and 02 villages of Kikuube district western Uganda with safe and clean water. This will help promote sanitation preventing the spread of water born diseases, covid 19, promoting formal education and economic development in homes. The wells will be excavated manually hitting the water table. A manual hand pump shall be installed on each well. The project is anticipated to last 18 months .

organisation.narrative: Buhaguzi Action For rural Development foundation(Buardefo)

title.narrative: COVID Emergency Hunger Relief for the Homeless

description.narrative: This project will provide hot meals to Homeless persons living on the elevated roadside platforms in Tamil Nadu, India. COVID-19 lockdown has severely impacted the lives of the Homeless who have no options to work and earn. They cannot even beg as none is seen on the road who can give them money or food.No restaurants, temples, and community kitchens are open to give them food or shelter. Your donations will help them have one freshly cooked hot meals a day!

organisation.narrative: Institute for Education, Research, and Scholarships

mailing-address.narrative: Newton Lee, 10209 Tujunga Canyon Blvd # 207, Tujunga, CA 91043, United States

title.narrative: Drinking Water to Navajo Nation Covid-19 Relief

description.narrative: In response to overwhelming need for drinking water throughout Navajo Nation, Can'd Aid is working to fulfill truckloads of water to the area as quickly as possible. The next shipment will be distributed to the White Mountain Apache Tribe in Whiteriver, Arizona. Within the White Mountain Apache Tribe includes a small community, Seven Mile, where currently COVID-19 cases have spiked to over 200 in the last week. Several other communities are in need as the summer temperatures rise.

mailing-address.narrative: Sara Hannafin, 20 Bowen St., Longmont, CO 80501, United States

title.narrative: Rosa's Covid-19 Fund for the UK Women's Sector

description.narrative: Rosa is a grantmaking charity that funds women's organisations across the UK. We have launched a response fund to provide grants to small, specialist women's organisations affected by the impact of Covid-19. Grants of up to 10,000 will help these organisations to deliver their vital services at this critical time of increased need. Those services include refuges for victims of domestic abuse, legal advice lines, maternity rights campaigns, specialist support for marginalised women, and more.

mailing-address.narrative: Seyi Newell, Rosa, 4th Floor, United House, North Road, London, N7 9DP, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Domestic Violence prevention in COVID quarantine

description.narrative: In Mexico domestic violence in quarantine increased in 120% within vulnerable families. This project will help 75 families of urban marginated municipalities of Mexico City, 300 family members, trough digital sessions of a team of experts, that will provide strategies for stress detection and reduction, resources for recognition and emotional regulation, positive discipline with out violence and tools for positive interaction between caregivers and children.

title.narrative: Footprints 4 Sam Super Sam Hero Vehicle Project

description.narrative: Footprints 4 Sam offers hope & dignity to underprivileged children with chronic illness. Our vehicle initiative launched in 2018 helps children with chronic illness to more readily access clinic & hospital appointments in Cape Town, South Africa. We have transported over 1700 children (Over 3500 passengers including caregivers & siblings). During Covid_19 we have delivered medication, food and toiletries to these families. We would like to expand this programme and ensure its sustainability.

mailing-address.narrative: Melissa Williams-Platt, 12 Sparrow Drive, Magaliessig, 2067, Gauteng, South Africa, Gauteng, 2067, South Africa

description.narrative: As the coronavirus continues to spread, its devastating effects are being felt around the world including in our community in rural Nicaragua. Waves of Hope, is excited to be teaming up with our friends at Rise Up Kids with the common goal of making sure that people are nourished and looked after during this challenging time. Together we share the common goal of making sure that families have access to food, clean water, healthcare, emergency supplies and other essential items.

mailing-address.narrative: Jamie Collum, 2 Fenwick Ave., Toronto, ON M4K3H3, Canada

title.narrative: Emergency Relief Packs for 700 Families in Armenia

description.narrative: The situation related with the spread of COVID-19 has a drastic effect especially on the lives of the children and families living in extreme poverty.We have selected 700 extremely poor families in Armenia where the need is especially severe. As a result, these 700 families will be secured with food and hygiene packages. They urgently need support from all of us. We are now working to support these families, but our resources are limited and we need YOUR support to be able to serve all of them.

organisation.narrative: World Vision Armenia Child Protection Foundation

title.narrative: Improving nutrition needs for 250 HIV+ children.

description.narrative: The lockdown as a result of COVID 19 in Uganda, has left HIV+ children gravely affected by lack of basic needs such as food, thus compromising the effectiveness of their treatment. Lack of proper nutrition, has left many starving, hardly having a meal a day. This exposes them to treatment failure and increased viral load which may see more deaths even after the pandemic. Project aims at saving life for 250 HIV+ children by providing food nutritious porridge, milk etc in Mityana Districts.

mailing-address.narrative: PaCT Uganda, P.O Box 289, Kitinkokola, Ttamu Division, Mityana Muncipality, Mityana District, Mityana Municipality, Kampala, Uganda +256, Uganda

title.narrative: Help 350 families grow food to overcome COVID-19

description.narrative: If you cannot work or lose your job due to the crisis, how do you feed your family? Let's provide 350 families with the knowledge and tools to grow their own food! We plan to co-design and build 20 urban food gardens with local communities whose income have been severely affected by COVID-19 and are struggling to feed their families. The families will also receive training so that they can use these gardens sustainably to provide food for their families now and be more resilient in the future.

mailing-address.narrative: Eleanore Henderson, Santa Julia 514, Nunoa, Santiago de Chile, 7760267, Chile

title.narrative: Help Protect Families from Disease with Safe Water

description.narrative: Now more than ever, access to safe water is critical to the health of our world. The spread of the novel coronavirus has highlighted the power of safe, reliable water in protecting communities and saving lives. This project will provide 500 families in Ghana with a month supply of clean water during these challenging times and help protect them from disease.

mailing-address.narrative: Marisa Xhafa, 122 East 42nd Street, 28th Floor, New York, NY 10168, United States

description.narrative: The COVID 19 Sanitary Pack Drive will support 500 vulnerable girls in Kilifi County, Kenya to help them manage their menstrual health hygienically and in a more dignified way. These girls are currently experiencing difficult times in regard to their menstrual health since most of the places they depended on for the free supply of pads have been closed indefinitely due to the COVID19 pandemic. This project will provide them with a sanitary package; sanitary towels, pants, and bathing soap.

mailing-address.narrative: Lydia Otieno, Mnarani Kilifi Kenya, Kilifi, 80108, Kenya

title.narrative: Supporting Women in Science During COVID-19

description.narrative: For women in Kenya, science is not an easy career to get into. For those who choose this career path, there is often a lack of mentorship and job opportunities. We are proud to support a dynamic team of Kenyan female scientists, actively working in science and, inspiring younger girls to follow their dreams. As the COVID-19 virus continues to impact our life's, we continue to support these women, despite our own financial losses. Help us support these amazing female scientists.

title.narrative: Health & Education rights for all in South Africa

We have led the fight for health and education rights for the past ten years and continue to do so through monitoring, advocacy, and litigation during the COVID-19 pandemic. With your support, our able team will be able to continue our work on sexual and reproductive health rights, school safety, universal health care, education for children with disabilities, and mental health during Covid-19.

title.narrative: Relief Packages for Transgender Youth in Pakistan

description.narrative: We will distribute relief packages to 250 HIV-positive Transgender youth in Multan who are in urgent need of these items. Relief packages include COVID-19 prevention items - surgical masks (10), hand sanitizer (2), gloves (10), tissue pack (1), soap (5) - and food - rice (3 kg), wheat flour (5 kg), sugar (2 kg), tea (1 kg), nutritional supplement powdered milk (400 gm), chickpeas (1 kg), split green gram (500 gm), split red lentil (500 gm), dates (200 gm), oil pouch (2 liter), salt (8 gm).

Managed in collaboration with FEED technical partner Ocean Quest Global, Coral Propagation Certified members of Jongky Surf School, and with coral nursery support from 45 trained members of the local La Union Surf Club, Inc. (LUSC) - oldest surf association in the Philippines.

description.narrative: The Maasai community along the edge of the Maasai Mara National Reserve is suffering from an acute collapse of food and health security in the wake of COVID-19. This project will purchase and deliver food and other life-saving provisions to over 300 rural families in extreme need in the Maasai Mara. It will also provide sanitary supplies to girls, deliver school materials, and provide much-needed education on containing the virus. The project will make a tangible impact on 5000 people.

description.narrative: This project will help feed the 106 horses that live at Horses of Tir Na Nog for one month. Each June we invite our supporters to help us celebrate the Celtic Moon of the Horses with an Irish pub fundraiser. Since that is not possible this year due to Covid-19 we are asking everyone to help us celebrate from afar. Covid-19 has not reduced our need to care for abused and neglected horses, in fact we have never cared for as many horses as we are in 2020!

mailing-address.narrative: Amy-Pat Rigney, P.O. Box 19131, San Diego, CA 92159, United States

title.narrative: Help Betty provide food & masks to Mukuru students

description.narrative: Betty runs the successful Gatoto School that has fed and educated 1,000 children in Mukuru kwa Reuben, Nairobi for 25 years. But COVID-19 is a risk multiplier. As schools and meals stop, children go hungry. Betty's resourceful thinking has pivoted the school resources to provide critical meals to her poorest families, water and hygiene supplies, and 4,000 face masks to the greater community as a preventive measure against the virus. She needs our support to continue these critical services.

mailing-address.narrative: Yassi Tamdji, 4320 Tuckerman Street, University Park, MD 20782, United States

title.narrative: Support youth in four communities in Timor-Leste

description.narrative: Funding will support early intervention and prevention activities, case work services and an education re-engagement program to up to 200 at-risk youth in four marginalised communities in Dili, Timor-Leste. There are high rates of educational disengagement, domestic violence and gang membership amongst youth in Dili, and the COVID-19 pandemic has marginalised them further. Supporting young people to access support services, and re-engaging them in education will be critical to their future.

organisation.narrative: Youth Off The Streets - Overseas Relief Fund Limited

mailing-address.narrative: Mitchell Rose, 28 Bowden St, Alexandria, Sydney, NSW 2015, Australia

title.narrative: Restore lives of 300 households in Kasese Uganda

description.narrative: In Kasese District, and the Rwenzori region of Uganda, hundreds of vulnerable children and women are living in camps with no food, clean water, shelter and hygiene facilities after losing everything they had to floods. Joy for Children Uganda (JFCU) is working to restore their lives. By donating to this cause, you will not only impact on the lives of 100,000 children, women and men affected by floods and at risk of being abused but also prevent the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Joy for Children Uganda, P.O Box 15383, Clock Tower, Kampala, Uganda 256, Uganda

title.narrative: Covid-19: Food for street children in Mumbai

description.narrative: The project provides water, food and basic necessities to the street children and their families in Bombay. The entire population of the city is confined due to the Covid-19 pandemic, and more of 40,000 children live in the streets while their families are unable to work to meet their essential needs. In the current situation, they are more threatened by hunger than by the virus. We intend to reach at least 3,600 children and their families with food and hygienic products.

title.narrative: A turn to learn-educate a deaf child in Zimbabwe

description.narrative: What does going to school mean to a deaf child in Zimbabwe? It means acceptance in the family and a chance to learn sign language. This project will reduce the burden of school fees for 50 families of deaf children, and support recovery from the economic effects of Covid-19 lockdown. It will give children continued learning at home and enable them to immediately get back into school when they reopen. Your contributions cover fees and learner packs; parent business training and start up kits.

Combined with the COVID-19 pandemic, the need for local food production is urgent. INMED South Africa's SEEDS FOR LIFE campaign will help 2,500 households plant home gardens. Your donation will provide free seeds and training to families on the brink of starvation, with future assistance to ensure the gardens and families thrive.

Our project will deliver access to necessary medication for over 1,000 patients in 18 rural, underserved communities in the Dominican Republic.

The outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic has created unprecedented difficulties for these marginalised groups, isolating and depriving them of the crucial social, psychological, legal and medical support offered by these two respected NGOs.

They are committed to returning to the African continent post-graduation to contribute to its development. To do so, we provide them with career training, including access to a quality internship on the continent. Due to the recent pandemic, internships abroad have been cancelled. description.narrative: Yemen is a place for civil war. Women & Children are the most affected by the six years' war.With COVID-19 pandemic impact which effected (the already destroyed economic) and caused closing works, the situation gets worse for families headed by Women. Concern Org. providing feeding and health support for vulnerable women and their children.Women and children in Yemen are facing risks in their lives and our work ensure their survival,well-being,empower women and inspiring effective solutions.

person-name.narrative: Concern Organization for Women & Children CWC

mailing-address.narrative: Concern Organization for Women & Children CWC, Amman st.sixty road, Sana'a, Sana'a, Sana'a +967, Yemen

title.narrative: Covid Can't Win! Help Support Survivors & Families

description.narrative: Trapped! Our Modern Day Prison! COVID-19 has destroyed countless lives globally & thrust millions into poverty & needless suffering. The Masses have lost their zeal for life & hope for tomorrow! The Covid Can't Project & iNYLAC reminds us Daily that Together, We're Stronger Than any Obstacle! Working Together we provide Masks, Food, Supplies, Support & Encouragement in the USA to those hardest hit! Proving that Social Distancing is Not Social Isolation! We Are in this Together & We Will Win!

organisation.narrative: True Help & Empowerment for Women & Aspiring Youth Foundation USA

mailing-address.narrative: Felicia Henderson, 9203 Hwy 6 South, Suite #124-236, Houston, TX 77083, United States

title.narrative: Access to 2.500 menstrual cups for girls and women

description.narrative: The project will deliver 2.500 menstrual cups to girls, women of Afro- Colombian women, migrants and adolescents in vulnerable conditions in Colombia. We want to relieve them of the economic burdens caused by having to take care of their menstrual hygiene care during the COVID-19 pandemic and to contribute to their autonomy, offering a more sustainable method. We would like also to help dispel myths and taboos about menstruation.

mailing-address.narrative: Maria Vivas, Carrera 17 # 33-50, Bogota, Cundinamarca 110311, Colombia

title.narrative: Empowering poor to fight COVID-19 in South Sudan

description.narrative: Charity and Empowerment Foundation (CEF) support poor families in South Sudan to fight COVID-19 by distributing soaps and handwashing facilities. Through the distribution of soaps and handwashing facilities, we are helping 1200 households to protect themselves from COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Gai Chol Paul, Baping License Center, Juba Town Market, Juba, 93, South Sudan

title.narrative: Keep at-risk children dancing and fed in Kenya

description.narrative: School closure due to COVID presents an unprecedented risk to children's education, protection and well-being. ChezaCheza will give 200+ children in Kibera (Africa's largest urban slum) dance & life skills classes, a warm meal and food packages to feed their family. We are a non-profit that provides at-risk children with quality life skills education through dance in safe spaces through local mentors. Let's keep the families in our community safe, healthy and dancing during this crisis!

mailing-address.narrative: Cherrelle Druppers, Maple Court H4, Galana Road, Nairobi, 22917-00505, Kenya

title.narrative: Support food aid to 3000 refugees in Cameroon

description.narrative: Key Farmers Cameroon plans to build a modern cassava production, processing and transformation Centre in Kumba and help provide free vocational training to 10 women groups (300 female headed households) who hail from impoverished communities so they can follow up a food distributing project and also provide free meals to 3000 refugees, orphans, covid-19 victims and internally displaced persons (IDPs) traumatized by the anglophone crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: Etchi Daniel Jones, P.O. BOX 360 KUMBA, +237 677572113, KUMBA, South West P.O.Box 360, Cameroon

description.narrative: Provide direct food assistance to the elderly & medically at-risk populations during pandemic situations through door to door delivery and mailed to door shipments.

mailing-address.narrative: Alicia River, 75 Washington St, #762, Fairburn, GA 30213, United States

title.narrative: Virtual Creativity Camp for Positive Mental Health

description.narrative: This summer, Trust For Youth and Child Leadership International will offer a Virtual Creativity Camp for Positive Mental Health. In response to the mental health challenges faced by disadvantaged youth during COVID-19 and the ongoing racial crisis, this program will provide one week of virtual sessions including painting, spoken word, collaborative theater, and creative movement. Youth will be guided through the arts to express their own stories and understand their own thoughts and feelings.

organisation.narrative: Trust for Youth and Child Leadership TYCL International Inc

mailing-address.narrative: SIVA Mathiyazhagan, 509 West 121st Street, NEW YORK, NY 10027, United States

title.narrative: To Prevent spread and mitigate impact of COVID-19

description.narrative: Bamenda is a densely populated and conflict-prone area and a host to more than 25000 IDPs, and pre-existing vulnerabilities that are likely to be exacerbated by the pandemic. IDPs and vulnerable families may not be able to feed and provide basic needs for their children and families in the coming weeks. Within this context SUDAHSER is implementing a project with objective to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and mitigate the socio-economic impact for vulnerable and conflict affected communities

organisation.narrative: Sustainable development and Humanitarian services (SUDAHSER) Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: Sanguv Simon Peter Fomonyuy, Bamenda Mile four Nkwen, Bamenda, NW Region 216, Cameroon

description.narrative: The Project facilitates positive/creative self-expression via the written word to enhance cognitive skills, life skills, intellectual/emotional wellness, civility, non-violent problem-solving, social tolerance, and more. Its Literary Therapy and mentorship gives voice and validation to underserved populations. It builds relationships and promotes life skills learning while addressing mental health/behavioral stressors/traumas-especially during the challenges of the global COVID-19 Pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Yvonne Medley, 1282 Smallwood Dr W, Suite 107, Waldorf, MD 20603, United States

title.narrative: Wildlife trade study in Indonesia during COVID-19

description.narrative: COVID-19 is a wake-up call for our planet. The illegal wildlife trade is not only a serious threat to wildlife but also responsible for the potential emergence and spread of many zoonotic diseases that can cause human pandemics. For this project, we would like to study and film the current situation of wildlife trade in Eastern Indonesia and start discussions with the communities about the most sustainable solutions for its mitigation.

mailing-address.narrative: George Olah, 5645 Hard Rock Pl, Budapest, Hungary

title.narrative: Covid-19 Relief Fund for Vulnerable Communities

description.narrative: This project will support Health Horizons International's efforts to build and strengthen clinical capacity on COVID-19 mitigation and community health outcomes. This will affect 20,000 people living with chronic diseases in socioeconomically and politically disadvantaged communities in the Caribbean through the training, development, and empowerment of community health workers that will provide accessible, affordable, and quality health care services.

mailing-address.narrative: Eliezer Lappots Abreu, One Regency Drive PO Box 30, Bloomfield, CT 06002, United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 emergency response in South Africa

description.narrative: MSF teams are racing to respond to the Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic in over 70 countries, including opening projects in new countries as they become pandemic hotspots. Our COVID-19 response focuses on three main priorities: supporting authorities to provide care for COVID-19 patients; protecting people who are vulnerable and at risk; and keeping essential medical services running In South Africa we are focusing on HIV. TB & SGBV affected patients. DONATE NOW!

mailing-address.narrative: Bongolethu Maqungo, 70 Fox Street, Marshalltown, Johannesburg, 2191, South Africa

title.narrative: COVID-19 Recovery for At-Risk Youth & Families

description.narrative: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic many support services our youth were accustomed to ceased operations. SOAR was able to maintain contact with our community partners, youth and families, & referring agencies,pivoting our programming to a virtual platform, & connecting with our youth 1-on-1 & as a community. We have supported our families with household needs such as cleaning supplies, toiletries & hygiene needs, paper products, & resources for monetary or technological support & assistance.

mailing-address.narrative: Chantae Thomas, 14306 E. Temple Place, Unit D, Aurora, CO 80015, United States

title.narrative: Coding Skills and Employment to overcome COVID-19

description.narrative: Colombia is one of the most unequal countries in Latin America. The COVID-19 crisis has highlighted these inequalities since millions have lost their jobs or their access to education. MAKAIA will train 100 women, youth and unemployed from low-income communities in coding and programming so they can acquire the right skills to get jobs, build a career path, or start their own businesses. The opportunities in the technology sector will continue to grow and they need to be accessible to all.

mailing-address.narrative: Yesica Gomez, Cra 43 A # 34 - 115. Almacentro, North Tower. Office 701, Medellin, Antioquia 050034, Colombia

description.narrative: We hope you will join us and individuals around the world and within The Bahamas in supporting our food relief efforts during this difficult time. As unemployment continues to rise due to a decline in tourism, the need for greater food assistance in hard-hit areas is more present than ever. Lend a Hand Bahamas is currently supporting over 2,500 individuals with much-needed food relief.

mailing-address.narrative: Lucas Metropulos, 11 Lewis Street, Nassau, 00000, Bahamas, The

title.narrative: Community Engagement for Mitigation of COVID-19

description.narrative: Uganda registered its first case of COVID-19 on 21 March 2020.The enforcement of a lock down since April, has negatively impacted the well being of vulnerable children and their families whose life depended on daily income from market stalls or offering labour.There is now urgent need for food and basic needs to save lives of these children from HIV+ and elderly families.$10 dollars is worth a meal for a family for a week.

mailing-address.narrative: Kenneth Massa, Plot 2411 Kyamagwa, Email: info@pushcommunity.org /pushcommunityinitiative@gmail.com, Jinja, Jinja P.O.BOX 1655 Jinja, Uganda

description.narrative: THis COVID-19 Fund is to support Small rural areas of Haiti during this difficult time, in response to COVID-19 DMI is providing Sanitation, Health Care and Education. These communities need more detail Information, they lack access to quality information on how to better protect themselves, and have been impacted by COVID-19. Your donation to this fund will help stop COVID-19's spread in some of the more remote areas around Haiti and these people have been really affected by this pandemic .

description.narrative: Turkish Education Foundation (TEV) is undertaking a new project named GRATITUDE TO CORONA HEROES FUND to support the education of children of healthcare workers in healthcare workers in Turkey who have forfeited their lives in the frontlines of this struggle due to COVID-19. Moreover, the scope of the fund will be extended to support more students who faced with negative effects of the pandemic as the Fund's support rises.

title.narrative: Help families in Thailand suffering from hunger

description.narrative: Thailand is home to a rich culture of almost 70 million people. Many of these are desperately poor. These poor (sometimes tribal communities such as Thai Yai, Karen or Akha) are often sought out by traffickers because of the need for money. COVID's hurting these populations ability to work making the risk from traffickers increased dramatically. We at "Bread for Life" provide food specific to poor at risk communities and seek to develop relationships to help break the cycle of poverty.

mailing-address.narrative: Timothy Dunham, 397/2 Moo 7, T. Mae Hia, A. Muang, Chiang Mai, 50100, Thailand

title.narrative: Help recovery from Cyclone Amphan in West Bengal

description.narrative: In mid-May 2020 Cyclone Amphan- the worst cyclone in 20 years- hit West Bengal. Already suffering from effects of the coronavirus, the region lost water and electricity mains, homes were destroyed and areas became unsafe. Karuna has long-term links with communities in West Bengal, supporting marginalised groups such as girls at risk of violence, children with disabilities and daily wage labourers. We are receiving regular updates from partners of the urgency for food parcels and health kits.

mailing-address.narrative: Akashamitra Turnbull, 72 Holloway Road, London, England United Kingdom

title.narrative: Support 22 Children During Covid-19 in Jo'burg

description.narrative: This project will ensure that we are able to continue supporting our children beyond 2020. Thandanani needs your support to ensure the continued well-being and education of 22 vulnerable children in Zandspruit, Johannesburg, South Africa. But their future is in jeopardy as donors understandably redirect their funds to Covid-19 relief initiatives.

organisation.narrative: Kingsway Centre of Concern: Thandanani House of Refuge

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief for NYC's Refugee Families

description.narrative: This campaign will provide direct support to the refugee population we serve in New York City, a group that has already faced significant challenges, and is now particularly vulnerable to COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Danny Stern, 711 Third Avenue, Suite 700, New York, NY 10017, United States

title.narrative: Covid19 Food Relief To Rural Communities

description.narrative: Uganda's lock down has closed all non-essential businesses & services, as the government ramps up preventative measures to combat Covid-19. The pandemic is affecting the lives of those living in poverty. In response,our organisation is already conducting a short-term food relief, & is starting efforts for long-term relief for rural families in the communities. Your donation to this fund will provide a food relief& support to the families of these communities during this challenging time.

mailing-address.narrative: Diiro Juma, Bugembe Jinja, Katende Road, Jinja, Eastern Region 00256, Uganda

title.narrative: Help us to provide online education.

description.narrative: As COVID-19 continues to spread, the future has never felt so unpredictable at our school. Right now, we're doing everything possible to sustain daily operations and provide education services to our community. We have started a distance program with a close support and accompaniment to all families, but most of them don't have the resources to afford online programs yet. We expect to provide tablets or lap tops to all our students and improve their education.

organisation.narrative: Asociacion Civil Yachay Wasi Casa Cultural Ollantaytambo

mailing-address.narrative: Guillermina Sanchez, Maskabamba s/n, Calle Cruz Esquina s/n, Ollantaytambo, Urubamba 000, Peru

title.narrative: Hands for life: Neonatology for newborns in Benin

description.narrative: The project "Hands for life" aims at the construction of a neonatology department in the pediatric hospital L'Abbraccio in Sokponta (Benin).This structure will be used to monitor the health of infants who are premature, underweight or have specific infections or malformations and to make women aware of the importance of receiving medical treatment during and after gestation.Furthermore we want to implement health awareness activities in rural villages to prevent infectious disease and Covid-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Francesca Moratti, via Curiel 21/d, Melzo, 20066, Italy

description.narrative: Waterkeeper Alliance is working with Uganda Lake Victoria Waterkeeper and Lake Kyoga Waterkeeper to protect vulnerable communities from the spread of COVID-19 with the installation of permanent handwashing stations needed to prevent the spread of disease. The Waterkeepers will create COVID-19 Task Forces in 40 fishing villages to construct and maintain 80 permanent handwashing stations equipped with soap and water, and provide temperature guns for village health teams to protect 24,300 people.

mailing-address.narrative: Mary Beth Postman, 180 Maiden Lane, New York, NY 10038, United States

title.narrative: Surviving COVID-19 in Russian Nursing Homes

description.narrative: For more than 12 years "Enjoyable Ageing" has been supporting about 350 care homes in 50 regions of Russia. We strove for better quality of life for residents as well as for making care homes more open and comfortable to live in. And it worked until the pandemic changed everything in just a few days. Most care homes went on lockdown leaving elderly residents isolated, and many members of staff fell ill. Those who keep working experience critical shortages of personal protective equipment (PPE).

mailing-address.narrative: Alla Romanovskaya, Sadovo-Triumfalnaya, 4-10, Moscow, 127006, Russia

description.narrative: We are operating in Russia, where the number of people infected COVID-19 keeps increasing. Russia is a big country, and it's hard for hospitals to handle the situation with COVID-19, especially in small towns. There is a list of what is required - stuff for the personal protection of the doctors, drugs and equipment for the hospitals. Every day hospitals ask us for help. Every request is being verified. We believe that together we can help to save more people's lives!

mailing-address.narrative: Anna Mikhailova, Magnitogorskaya str, 9, k1, Moscow, Moscow 105568, Russia

title.narrative: Support Dandora Residents Cope with COVID-19

description.narrative: "Support Dandora Residents Cope With COVID-19" pandemic, is a project that intends to reduce the spread of COVID-19 in Dandora slums through public education, the supply of water & hygiene kits, access to sanitation & provide food to vulnerable families who have been affected by the COVID-19. The project seeks to support people who lost their business restart them in a post-COVID-19 pandemic to stop them & their children from going back to the dumpsite or resorts to negative coping mechanisms.

mailing-address.narrative: George Onyango, P.O. BOX 14909-00100, John Osogo Road, Dandora, Nairobi, Nairobi 254, Kenya

description.narrative: Four years into the Anglophone Crisis coupled with the COVID 19 pandemic, hundreds have been recorded dead, over a thousand homes burned and over 900,000 people have fled their homes. Denis Miki Foundation is working with several local communities affected by the crisis to ensure that internally displaced women are supported to start micro-businesses, have access to their basic needs and basic health care through health insurance as they struggle to get settled in their new environments.

mailing-address.narrative: Emilia Miki, P.O. Box 247, Limbe, South West Region 237, Cameroon

title.narrative: Support Refugee and Local Women's Resilience

description.narrative: Women, especially poors and refugees, have been impacted by spread of COVID-19 severely. They are more likely to be working in the informal labor market, and will more likely to be left without social protection as a result of economic recession or shutdown. This project will support initiatives of refugee and local women to overcome the negative impacts of COVID-19 and to build their resilience against the aftershocks by solidarity and self-support groups and joint economic initiatives.

mailing-address.narrative: Gokcen Durutas, Bekar Sk. No:17 Beyoglu, Istanbul, Turkey

description.narrative: This project will provide 43 high achieving students from Mukuru, the second largest slum in Nairobi, Kenya, with tablet computers and six months of wifi to access their online education until schools reopen. Schools have physically closed during the covid-19 pandemic, and therefore the only opportunity to access education is online.

mailing-address.narrative: Sherry Fine, 170 E 88TH St Apt 4H, New York, NY 10128, United States

title.narrative: Food for Colombian children with disabilities

description.narrative: Due to the health emergency caused by Covid-19 in Colombia, thousands of vulnerable families who meet their basic needs thanks to informal jobs face a crisis of food shortages, which mainly affects growing and developing children, adolescents and adults with health complications. This project seeks to provide relief through the delivery of kits with food and personal care products to 100 families who do not have the resources or help from third parties to have food on their homes.

mailing-address.narrative: Social Area, Carrera 50 # 52 - 22, Edificio Bermora of 606, Medellin, Antioquia 050012, Colombia

title.narrative: Stop violence against women in times of Covid-19

description.narrative: This project was born from the need to address violence from a gender perspective. It is appropriate to activate actions that allow counteracting all forms of violence, especially in the current Covid-19 crisis, where the Colombian government took the mandatory quarantine measure that has lasted for more than two months. This project seeks to attend, prevent and activate routes in cases of domestic violence with 30 women and mothers who are caretakers and contribute to minimizing the risks.

mailing-address.narrative: Social Area, Carrera 50 # 52 - 22, Edificio Bermora of 606, Medellin, Antioquia 050012, Colombia

description.narrative: The plight of underprivileged families rarely receives the same amount of attention or exposure from the media and internet as they hardly have access to these channels to highlight their predicament, especially in times of Covid-19. Therefore, we reach out to this target group by allocating funds and resources to mitigate their burden in seeking healthcare on dialysis treatment.

mailing-address.narrative: JH Yuen, Blok N-7-03 The Gamuda Biz Suites,, Persiaran Anggerik Vanilla, Kota Kemuning, Shah Alam, Selangor 40460, Malaysia

title.narrative: The Saint Lucia National Trust C-19 Relief Fund

description.narrative: The Saint Lucia National Trust (SLNT) is mandated to protect Saint Lucia's patrimony. Revenue from the Pigeon Island National Landmark, our flagship site, is our main source of income, which helps us to preserve other historic sites, and landscapes with their flora and fauna, some of which are endemic species. With the removal of the Government subvention in 2017 and responses to COVID-19 we face uncertainty for both our conservation work and our dedicated staff. Please help keep the SLNT alive!

mailing-address.narrative: Joanne Norville, Saint Lucia National Trust, Pigeon Island National Landmark, Gros Islet, LC01 601, Saint Lucia

title.narrative: Support 100 vulnerable rural girls keep in school

description.narrative: The National COVID-19 pandemic lock-down in Uganda has greatly devastated many families, but the families of orphans and vulnerable children are the most hit.Children from these families can hardly access education study materials to facilitate continuous learning because they cannot afford e-learning gadgets like televisions,radios, internet or newspapers.We urgently need your support to help vulnerable rural girls access continuous learning and also to economically empower their families.

mailing-address.narrative: Mutyaba James Claude, P.Box 12578 Kampala, Mityana, Central 256, Uganda

title.narrative: Limiting dissemination of COVID-19 in Gaza Strip

description.narrative: As of 31st May, 2020 there are 61 cases of COVID-19 in Gaza Strip, and as the virus could easily spread, this project comes to confront COVID19 by protecting the medical team, workers and patients in Al Awda Hospital which is one of the main and largest hospitals in the Northern governorate of Gaza Strip, where the hospital's staff and beneficiaries will be provided with Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) & disinfectants, moreover poor families will be provided with hygiene kits.

title.narrative: Responding to COVID-19 Challenges - Africa & India

description.narrative: Over 3000 children daily are being helped out of poverty through the schools, homes & care that Hands Around the World's partner projects in Kenya, Zambia, Benin, Rwanda & India provide. We are in the process of creating an emergency strategy to combat the urgent issues facing our projects as a result of Covid-19. This will allow HATW to continue to make a long-lasting difference in the young lives of those we support, whilst maximising the impact of available funding and minimising overheads.

mailing-address.narrative: Bridget Higginson, 24 Church Street, MONMOUTH, MONMOUTHSHIRE NP25 3BU, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Hospital Playground for Recovering Sick Children

description.narrative: This project will begin the building of a children's playground area in one of Greece's main hospitals, the University Hospital in Heraklion, Crete. Every year thousands of children from different countries receiving care will benefit physically and emotionally from a place to play together in the mild climate, especially those with respiratory diseases like Covid 19. Playing is proven to help sick children overcome their illness, build strength and help them cope.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Emergency Relief for Guatemalan Artisans

description.narrative: Cojolya Association of Maya Women Weavers has been hard hit by the economic crisis spurred on by the global Coronavirus pandemic. We are seeking donations in order for us to be able to continue to provide employment and community support to our weavers. We aim to continue our textile production, our Mano a Mano por el Desarollo education program, as well as offer food and hygiene distributions on a monthly basis as needed in the wider community.

While it may not change the whole world, it surely will change someone's whole world, and as a part of a global family, such an impact goes a long way.

title.narrative: A COVID-19 appeal -The Species Distancing Campaign

description.narrative: Social distancing amidst COVID-19 is only an afterthought within a purely symptomatic treatment plan-and a desperate step that goes against our very nature of being social animals. What we need is inter-species distance rather than being away from our own kind, using ready natural buffers - OUR FORESTS. Help us save at least 150 acres of vulnerable forests in the Western Ghats,India (a global biodiversity hotspot) in order to create safe ecosystems for all us species! LIVE & LET LIVE TO LIVE
